definition: civilian post (as opposed to military)/civil service/administration

sentences.english: He will start his new civilian job at the CIA in September.
sentences.chinese: 他将在九月份开始他在中央情报局的新的文职工作。

sentences.english: After the revolution, MEK was amongst the most stalwart supporters of the clerical regime.
sentences.chinese: 革命以后，MEK是文职政权最坚实的支持者。

sentences.english: Nominations will reflect service or achievement of a lesser degree than recognized by the Superior Civilian Service Award.
sentences.chinese: 这种勋章的等级低于卓越文职人员服役奖章。

sentences.english: When applying for Employees' Compensation, please give details on separate sheets for non-clerical staff.
sentences.chinese: 若为非文职雇员申请雇员赔偿保障，请另纸说明详情。

sentences.english: But for civilian leaders as well as for China’s friends, this would be highly problematical.
sentences.chinese: 但对文职领导人和中国的朋友来说，这将很有问题。

sentences.english: But the military is now completely under civilian leadership.
sentences.chinese: 但军方现在完全由文职人员领导。

sentences.english: Civilians in little knots chatted in the sunshine .
sentences.chinese: 文职人员三五成群在阳光下聊天。

sentences.english: Cadres of the PLA include officers and non- ranking cadres.
sentences.chinese: 人民解放军的干部包括军官和文职干部。

sentences.english: He even accused his former civil servants of being like Dad's Army.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至指责他以前手下的文职人员象“老爷兵”。

sentences.english: Downey and Fecteau were identified as Department of the Army civilian employees.
sentences.chinese: 唐尼和费克图被说成是陆军部的文职雇员。

definition: main job/day job/steady full-time job (as opposed to temporary or casual)/chief or principal post (as opposed to deputy)
warrant officer/petty officer/noncommissioned officer (NCO)/Japanese military officer
odd jobs/servant or army orderly doing odd jobs
